metadata.title: CVE-2021-28964 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A race condition was discovered in get_old_root in fs/btrfs/ctree.c in theLinux kernel through 5.11.8. It allows attackers to cause a denial ofservice (BUG) because of a lack of locking on an extent buffer before acloning operation, aka CID-dbcc7d57bffc.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28964` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-generic - 4.4.0-223.256
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-223-lowlatency - 4.4.0-223.256
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-144-generic - 4.15.0-144.148~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-144-generic - 4.15.0-144.148~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-144-lowlatency - 4.15.0-144.148~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1104-kvm - 4.4.0-1104.113
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1139-aws - 4.4.0-1139.153
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1103-aws - 4.15.0-1103.110~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1115-azure - 4.15.0-1115.128~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1100-gcp - 4.15.0-1100.113~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1072-oracle - 4.15.0-1072.80~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-223.256').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-144.148~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1104.113').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1139.153').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1103.110~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1115.128~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1100.113~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1072.80~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1073.79').
